{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2019}} {{Infobox automobile |name = Saturn Sky |image = 2009 Saturn Sky Redline Ruby Red Limited Edition.jpg |caption = 2009 Saturn Sky Redline Ruby Red Limited Edition |manufacturer = [[General Motors]] |aka = {{Plainlist| *[[Opel GT#GT (roadster) (2007–2010)|Opel GT]] *Daewoo G2X }} |production = 2006–2009 |model_years = 2007–2010 |assembly = United States: [[Wilmington, Delaware]] ([[Wilmington Assembly]]) |designer = [[Franz von Holzhausen]] |class = [[Sports car]] |body_style = 2-door [[Roadster (automobile)|roadster]] |platform = [[GM Kappa platform]] |related = [[Pontiac Solstice]] |layout = [[Front-engine, rear-wheel-drive layout|FR layout]] |predecessor = [[Buick Reatta]] |engine = {{Plainlist| *2.4 [[litre|L]] ''[[GM Ecotec engine#LE5|LE5]]'' [[Inline-four engine|I4]] ([[Petrol engine|gasoline]]) *2.0 L ''[[GM Ecotec engine#2.0 LNF (Z20NHH Opel)|Ecotec LNF]]'' [[Turbocharger|turbo]] I4 (gasoline) }} | transmission = {{Plainlist| *5-speed [[Aisin Seiki|Aisin]] ''[[Aisin AR transmission|AR5]]'' [[manual transmission|manual]] *5-speed ''[[GM 5L40 transmission|5L40-E]]'' [[automatic transmission|automatic]] }} |wheelbase = {{convert|95.1|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |length = {{convert|161.1|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |width = {{convert|71.4|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |height = {{convert|50.2|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |weight = {{convert|2940|lb|kg||abbr=on}} (Base)
{{convert|3071|lb|kg||abbr=on}} (Red Line) }} The '''Saturn Sky''' is a [[Roadster (automobile)|roadster]] that was produced by [[Saturn Corporation|Saturn]], and was initially released in the first quarter of 2006 as a 2007 model. It uses the ''[[GM Kappa platform|Kappa]]'' [[automobile platform]] shared with the [[Pontiac Solstice]]. The Sky concept was shown at the [[North American International Auto Show#2005|2005 North American International Auto Show]], with the production version following at the 2006 show. It was built at GM's [[Wilmington Assembly]] plant in [[Wilmington, Delaware]], alongside the Solstice. The Sky featured 18-inch (457 mm) wheels and a 2.4 [[litre|L]] [[GM Ecotec engine#LE5|Ecotec ''LE5'']] [[Inline-four engine|I4]] engine that produced {{Convert|177|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}}, a new straight-4 2.0 L [[Turbocharger|turbocharged]] [[Gasoline direct injection|direct injected]] engine that made {{Convert|260|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} as well as an optional dealer-installed turbo upgrade kit that made {{Convert|290|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}}. Both five-speed [[manual transmission|manual]] and [[automatic transmission]]s were available. The styling for the Sky, penned by [[Franz von Holzhausen]], was based on the Vauxhall VX Lightning Concept's design. It was available in some European markets as the [[Opel GT#GT (roadster) (2007–2010)|Opel GT]]. A [[Rebadging|rebadged]] version named the '''Daewoo G2X''' was unveiled as a concept vehicle for the [[South Korea]]n market in 2006. The production version was released in September 2007.{{cite web|title='G2X Roadster' released!|url=http://archives.media.gm.com/archive/documents/domain_461/docId_38717_pr.html|publisher=GM Daewoo|accessdate=February 6, 2012|language=Korean|date=August 23, 2007}} The Wilmington Assembly plant closed in July 2009, ending production as both the Pontiac and Saturn nameplates were retired.{{cite web|title=GM Pulls Ahead U.S. Plant Closures; Reaffirms Intent to Build Future Small Car in U.S.|url=http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewpressreldetail.do?domain=827&docid=54632|publisher=GM Media Online|accessdate=June 1, 2009|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20090608161828/http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewpressreldetail.do%3Fdomain=827&docid=54632|archivedate=June 8, 2009}} ==Sky Red Line== [[File:2009 gray Saturn Sky Red Line steering wheel.JPG|thumb|left|Saturn Sky Red Line interior]] [[File:Sky 2009.jpg|thumb|left|2009 Saturn Sky]] A '''Red Line''' model of the Sky was introduced on April 11, 2006 at the [[New York Auto Show#2006|New York Auto Show]]. It uses the same {{Convert|260|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} [[turbocharger|turbocharged]] Ecotec engine as the [[Pontiac Solstice]], as well as the same standard 5-speed Aisin manual transmission. An automatic transmission is optional. The Red Line had a standard torque-sensing limited-slip differential, standard StabiliTrak stability control, and an enhanced sport suspension over the standard Sky (available as a dealer-add on for regular models). Other exterior enhancements included dual exhausts, 18-inch wheels, and a specific front fascia modeled for the Red Line. On the inside the Red Line had a special leather-wrapped steering wheel with audio controls, special embroidery on the seats and floor mats, metallic door sill covers and stainless steel pedals, special tachometer and gauges, and a digital boost gauge in the Driver Information Center. The Red Line model started shipping in the third quarter of 2006, with a retail price starting at $29,795. {| class="wikitable" |+Models |- !Trim!!Engine!!Power!!Torque!!Transmission |- |Base||2.4 [[litre|L]] ''[[GM Ecotec engine#LE5|LE5]]'' [[Inline-four engine|I4]]||{{Convert|177|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}}||{{convert|173|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}}||rowspan=3|5-speed [[Aisin AR transmission|Aisin AR-5]] manual, or
5-speed [[GM 5L40 transmission|GM 5L40-E]] automatic |- |Red Line||2.0 L ''[[GM Ecotec engine#2.0 LNF (Z20NHH Opel)|LNF]]'' I4||{{Convert|260|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}}||{{convert|260|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} |- |Red Line with
Turbo Upgrade Kit ||2.0 L ''LNF'' I4||{{Convert|290|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}}||{{convert|340|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} ([[Aisin AR transmission|MT]])
{{convert|325|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} ([[GM 5L40 transmission|AT]]) |}{{Clear}} ==Specifications== 2007 Saturn Sky (Base model) specifications: *0-{{convert|60|mph|km/h|abbr=on}}: 6.9 seconds *0-{{convert|100|mph|0|abbr=on}}: 21.9 seconds *1/4 mile: 15.2 seconds @ {{convert|88|mph|km/h|abbr=on}} *Top speed: {{convert|123|mph|km/h|0|abbr=on}} drag limited *{{convert|70|mph|0|abbr=on}}-0 mph braking: {{convert|174|ft|m|0|abbr=on}} *{{convert|300|ft|m|abbr=on}} skidpad: 0.86 g *EPA fuel economy: {{convert|20|mpgus|L/100 km mpgimp|abbr=on}} city/{{convert|28|mpgus|L/100 km mpgimp|abbr=on}} highway Source: Car and Driver http://media.caranddriver.com/files/2007-saturn-sky2007-saturn-sky-specs.pdf 2007 Saturn Sky Red Line specifications: *0-{{convert|60|mph|km/h|abbr=on}}: 5.2 seconds *0-{{convert|100|mph|0|abbr=on}}: 14.7 seconds *1/4 mile: 14.0 seconds @ {{convert|98|mi/h|km/h|0|abbr=on}} *Top speed: {{convert|141|mph|km/h|0|abbr=on}} drag limited *{{convert|70|mph|0|abbr=on}}-0 mph braking: {{convert|168|ft|m|0|abbr=on}} *{{convert|300|ft|m|abbr=on}} skidpad: 0.87 g *EPA fuel economy: {{convert|19|mpgus|L/100 km mpgimp|abbr=on}} city / ?? highway Source: Car and Driver http://www.caranddriver.com/reviews/2007-saturn-sky-red-line-short-take-road-test-specs-page-2 ==Limited editions== ===2008=== For the 2008 model year, GM offered the Carbon Flash Special Edition Saturn Sky. Unlike the two Limited Edition models launched later in 2009, its production was slightly higher at 550 units.{{cite web|url=http://www.skyroadster.com/forums/f13/official-carbon-flash-numbers-31953/|title=OFFICIAL Carbon Flash Numbers... - Saturn Sky Forums: Saturn Sky Forum|work=skyroadster.com}} The Carbon Flash Special Edition featured a unique metallic Carbon Flash paint color, removable silver racing stripe standard, and Monsoon premium audio standard. The largest differentiator however, is Carbon Flash Edition's silver inserts in the interior seating and steering wheel that provide a black-on-silver appearance. ===2009=== For the 2009 model year, GM launched two limited-edition Saturn Sky roadsters jointly; Ruby Red Special Edition and Hydro Blue Limited Edition. Both are VIN-coded[http://service.gm.com/dealerworld/vincards/pdf/vincard09%2003-07-12%20R1.6.pdf]{{Dead link|date=June 2019}} and some blue books track it as a limited edition vehicle. All limited editions featured Monsoon premium stereos. The Ruby Red Edition featured the Ruby Red color and a unique, removable carbon racing stripe that was exclusive to the 500 Sky units produced in this trim. The Hydro Blue Edition featured a Hydro Blue color, as well as matching blue-colored stitching in the seats and gear shifter. Also, the word Sky stitched into the seats is changed to matching-blue color as well. All Hydro Blue Edition Saturn Sky units were sold with the removable silver racing stripe. GM had planned to make 500 Hydro Blue units to match the 500 Ruby Red Special Edition Sky build count. However, Hydro Blue units were being built as GM was declaring bankruptcy, resulting in the immediate termination of the Kappa platform. As such, only 89 Hydro Blue Edition Saturn Sky roadsters were built.{{cite web|url=http://www.skyroadster.com/forums/f2/hydro-blue-database-thread-60602/|title=OFFICIAL Hydro Blue Numbers... - Saturn Sky Forums: Saturn Sky Forum|work=skyroadster.com}} The Hydro Blue paint color (and seat/shifter blue stitching) was offered on the [[Pontiac Solstice]]. However, it is not VIN coded as a unique/limited edition, racing stripes were not standard, and seats do not have blue-colored lettering. Hydro Blue is the rarest color in all three vehicles; Sky Roadster, Solstice Roadster, and Solstice Coupe. ==2010 production== In April and May 2009 the Wilmington, DE. plant built thirty 2010 model year VIN-coded cars on the Kappa platform. Of those, 8 were Saturn SKYs. The other remaining included 12 Pontiac Solstice Coupes, eight Pontiac Solstice roadsters, and two Opel GTs. They were then used as GM company vehicles to be evaluated and also as special event display vehicles. These vehicles were built to the 2010 model year specs with 2010 model year changes and had legal 2010 VIN numbers. All 8 2010 SKYs were purchased by the same dealer in Minnesota and subsequently sold as used vehicles. Among changes to the SKY for the 2010 model year were the addition of remote start on automatic equipped cars, option package changes and additions, and three new colors. Those colors were Kinetic Blue, Opus Green, and Dark Labyrinth Metallic. ===2010 SKYs produced=== * SKY, Black Lt. Cashmere Leather Tan LE5 Auto Chrome Air * SKY Redline, Kinetic Blue Black Leather Black LNF Auto Polished Air * SKY Redline, Black Red Leather Black LNF Auto Polished Air * SKY Redline, Dk Labyrinth Met Black Leather Black LNF Auto Chrome Air * SKY, Black Lt. Cashmere Leather Tan LE5 Manual Chrome * SKY Redline, Black Black Leather Black LNF Auto Chrome Air * SKY Redline, Dk Labyrinth Met Black Leather Black LNF Manual Chrome Air * SKY, Dk Labyrinth Met Black Leather Black LE5 Auto Chrome ==Production by model year== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Model Year ! Total Saturn Sky Production{{cite web|url=http://www.gm.com/corporate/investor_information/sales_prod/hist_prod.jsp |title=General Motors: Investors: Sales and Production Reports: Historical Production |publisher=GM |date=July 10, 2009 |accessdate=September 27, 2009}} |- | 2007 | 16,567 |- | 2008 | 13,662 |- | 2009 | 4,178 |- | 2010 | 8 |- |''' Total''' | '''34,415''' |} ==Yearly American sales== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Calendar Year ! Total American sales |- | 2006{{cite web|url=http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewmonthlyreleasedetail.do?domain=6&docid=31596 |title=GM Media Online |publisher=Media.gm.com |date=January 3, 2007 |accessdate=May 1, 2009 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20090221044819/http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewmonthlyreleasedetail.do%3Fdomain=6&docid=31596 |archivedate=February 21, 2009 }} | 8,671 |- | 2007 | 11,263 |- | 2008{{cite web |url=http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewpressreldetail.do?domain=2&docid=51161 |title=GM Media Online |publisher=Media.gm.com |date=January 5, 2009 |accessdate=May 1, 2009 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090423151551/http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http%3A%2F%2Fimage.emerald.gm.com%2Fgmnews%2Fviewpressreldetail.do%3Fdomain%3D2&docid=51161 |archivedate=April 23, 2009 }} | 9,162 |- | 2009{{cite web|url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/news/news_detail.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2010/Jan/0105_Dec_Sales |title=Chevrolet, Buick, GMC and Cadillac Post Sales Gains |publisher=Media.gm.com |date=January 5, 2010 |accessdate=January 5, 2010}} | 3,399 |- |''' Total''' | '''32,495''' |} ==Motorsport== An extremely modified Saturn Sky competes in the [[Formula D]] [[Drifting (motorsport)|drifting]] series, driven by [[Darren McNamara]] & sponsored by [[Falken Tires]]. It produces 800 hp and sports an [[aluminum]] [[turbocharged]] [[V8]] that displaces 6.7 liters. The car was built by [[Autosport Dynamics]]. ==See also== * [[Pontiac Solstice]] * [[Vauxhall VX220]] and [[Opel Speedster]] – European-market predecessors, both based on the [[Lotus Elise]] and built by [[Lotus Cars]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Saturn Sky}} *[https://web.archive.org/web/20111215161750/http://www.saturn.com/vehicles/saturn_vehicles.html#/SKY Official Saturn Sky website] *[http://g2x.gmdaewoo.co.kr/ Official Daewoo G2X website]{{dead link|date=June 2019}} {{Saturn Corporation}} {{GM Daewoo timeline}} [[Category:Saturn vehicles|Sky]] [[Category:Roadsters]] [[Category:Hardtop convertibles]] [[Category:Sports cars]] [[Category:Rear-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:2000s cars]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 2007]] [[Category:Motor vehicles manufactured in the United States]]

{{Single source|date=November 2018}}{{Infobox automobile | name = Saturn Curve | manufacturer = [[Saturn Corporation|Saturn]] ([[General Motors]]) | aka = | production = 2004 | assembly = | predecessor = | successor = | class = [[Concept car]] | body_style = 2-door [[Roadster (automobile)|roadster]] | layout = [[FR layout]] | platform = [[GM Kappa platform]] | engine = 2.0L inline-four [[GM Ecotec engine#Ecotec Gen I|Ecotec]], Supercharged. | transmission = | wheelbase = | length = | width = | height = | ground_clearance = | front_track = | rear_track = | weight = | top_speed = | related = [[Saturn Sky]]
[[Pontiac Solstice]]
[[Opel GT]] | designer = [[Michael Mauer]] | image = }} The '''Saturn Curve''' was a [[Roadster (automobile)|roadster]] [[concept car|concept]] by [[Saturn Corporation|Saturn]] designed by [[Michael Mauer]] who was the former head of design at [[Saab Automobile]]. It was shown at the [[North American International Auto Show#2004|2004 North American International Auto Show]] along with the [[Saturn Sky]] concept. This project would also evolve to a new "[[Saab Sonett]]", with a different front styling, {{CN|date=July 2014}} but ultimately Saab's intentions to make it an AWD car did not come true, and Saturn opted to go with the Opel project, giving birth to the Saturn Sky. ==External links== *[http://www.autointell.com/Events/naias-2004/naias-2004-daily/saturn-curve-04/saturn-curve-front-800.jpg Photo of the Saturn Curve] [[Category:Saturn vehicles|Curve]] [[Category:General Motors concept cars]] {{Modern-auto-stub}}{{Saturn automobile timeline 1991 to 2010}}

revision.comment: The Saturn brand was discontinued with no successors

[[Fiat Croma#Second generation .282005.E2.80.932011.29|Fiat Croma]]
[[Opel Signum]]
[[Opel Vectra#Vectra C .282002.E2.80.932009.29|Opel Vectra C]]
[[Pontiac G6]]
[[Saab 9-3#Second generation .282002.E2.80.932012.29|Saab 9-3]] |layout = [[Front-engine, front-wheel-drive layout|Transverse front-engine, front-wheel drive]] |engine = {{ubl |2.4 L ''[[GM Ecotec engine#LE5|LE5]]'' [[Straight-4|I4]] ([[gasoline]])||2.4 L ''[[GM Ecotec engine#LE9|LE9]]'' [[Straight-4|I4]] (gasoline/[[E85]])|2.4 L ''[[GM Ecotec engine#LAT|LAT]]'' ([[hybrid electric vehicle|hybrid]] gasoline / electric)|3.5 L ''[[GM High Value engine#LZ4|LZ4]]'' [[V6 engine|V6]] (gasoline)|3.6 L ''[[GM High Feature engine#LY7|LY7]]'' [[V6]] (gasoline)}} |transmission = {{ubl |4-speed ''[[GM 4T45-E transmission|4T45-E]]'' automatic|6-speed ''[[GM 6T70 transmission|6T70]]'' automatic|6-speed ''[[GM 6T40 transmission|6T40]]'' automatic}} |wheelbase = {{convert|112.3|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |length = {{convert|190.9|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |width = {{convert|70.3|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |height = {{convert|57.6|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |weight = {{convert|3781|lb|abbr=on}} |predecessor = [[Saturn L-Series]] }} The '''Saturn Aura''' is a [[mid-size car|midsize family sedan]] that was produced by [[Saturn Corporation|Saturn]]. It debuted as a [[concept car]] at the [[North American International Auto Show]] in January 2005. The production model of the Aura was shown at the 2006 [[New York Auto Show]] in April, with production commencing in North America in the summer of 2006 for the 2007 model year. The Aura replaced the [[Saturn L-Series]], which was discontinued after the 2005 model year.{{cite web |url=http://consumerguideauto.howstuffworks.com/2000-to-2005-saturn-l-series.htm |title=Saturn L-Series on Consumerguide.com |accessdate=2007-03-17 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070821134604/http://consumerguideauto.howstuffworks.com/2000-to-2005-saturn-l-series.htm |archivedate=2007-08-21 }} Although Saturn had never intended to use the Aura name for the production vehicle, the name ended up sticking as a result of the popularity of the concept.{{cite web|url=http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewmonthlyreleasedetail.do?domain=3&docid=16976|title=Saturn Announces New "Outlook" for Future Portfolio: Also Confirms "Aura" Name|accessdate=2008-04-21}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}} The Aura was considered an important model for both Saturn and General Motors.[http://www.edmunds.com/insideline/do/Columns/articleId=116831 Saturn is ready to turn a profit] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090210070823/http://www.edmunds.com/insideline/do/Columns/articleId=116831 |date=2009-02-10 }} It was part of a product rejuvenation for Saturn intended to make the brand profitable as well as competitive with European imports.{{cite web|url=http://www.saturnfans.com/Company/2007/thesaturnrevival.shtml|title=Rick Wagoner explains in this video what he has planned for the Saturn brand|accessdate=2007-03-17}} Reaction to the Aura was positive, both in terms of reviews and sales. The Saturn Aura was the 2007 North American [[Car of the Year]]. The concept used a 252 hp (186 kW) 3.6 L [[V6]] and a new ''[[GM 6T70 transmission|6T70]]'' six-speed [[automatic transmission]].{{cite web|url=http://www.autoblog.com/2005/01/07/detroit-auto-show-saturn-aura-concept/ |title=Saturn Aura concept auto show unveiling|work=autoblog.com|accessdate=2006-08-24}} That powertrain was offered in the production model known as the ''XR''. Also introduced was the 3.5 L V6 with 219 hp (163 kW), down from 224 in 2007 in the ''XE'', and the [[hybrid vehicle|hybrid]] 164 hp (122 kW) 2.4 L [[inline-4]], down from {{Convert|170|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}}, in the ''Green Line''. The Aura, developed on the [[GM Epsilon platform]], was available only as a [[sedan (car)|sedan]] and was built at the [[Kansas City, Kansas]], [[Fairfax Assembly]] plant. The model was discontinued after the 2010 model year as a direct result of the Saturn division being terminated that year. It was later revealed that a second-generation model based on the [[Opel Vectra|Vectra]]'s replacement, the [[Opel Insignia|Insignia]], was due to be released. However, with the discontinuation of the Saturn brand, the Insignia was offered to Buick, who released it as the fifth-generation [[Buick Regal]].{{fact|date=April 2020}} ==Design== ===Exterior=== [[File:Saturn-Aura-rear.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Note that the rear of the Aura sits higher than the front.]] The Aura was a new styling direction for Saturn, with styling that resembled its cousin, the European [[Opel Vectra]]. All Aura models came standard with folding side mirrors and side marker lights, lending to its European stylings. The design of the Aura Special appearance pieces included an integrated radio antenna in the rear window, a chrome appearance package available on XR models, standard 17 inch wheels with five-spoke wheel covers and P225/50R17 all-season tires on XE models, and standard 18 inch machined aluminum 14-spoke wheels on the XR with high-performance Goodyear Eagle LS2 P225/50R18 T tires. ===Interior=== [[File:Saturn-Aura-interior.JPG|200px|thumb|left|2007 Saturn Aura XR Interior]] The interior of the Aura also marked a new interior direction for Saturn, moving to a more European-style interior. The design of the interior of the Aura differed from that of the Ion, which was highly criticized.{{cite web|url=http://www.edmunds.com/saturn/ion/review.html|title=Saturn Ion review, Edmunds.com|accessdate=2007-03-17}}{{cite web |url=http://www.edmunds.com/apps/vdpcontainers/do/vdp/articleId=89620/pageNumber=1?synpartner=edmunds&pageurl=www.edmunds.com/used/2003/saturn/ion/100184118/roadtestarticle.html&articleId=89620 |title=2003 Saturn Ion review |accessdate=2007-03-17 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930035012/http://www.edmunds.com/apps/vdpcontainers/do/vdp/articleId%3D89620/pageNumber%3D1?synpartner=edmunds&pageurl=www.edmunds.com%2Fused%2F2003%2Fsaturn%2Fion%2F100184118%2Froadtestarticle.html&articleId=89620 |archivedate=2007-09-30 }} On the upscale XR model, the interior came with an option for saddle leather and paddle shifters, as well as an option for back seat radio controls.[http://www.saturn.com/saturn/vehicles/aura/pricing.jsp Saturn Aura Pricing and options: Saturn.com] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080215055755/http://www.saturn.com/saturn/vehicles/aura/pricing.jsp |date=2008-02-15 }} Despite being praised for its design and fit and finish, the Aura's interior was criticized for using cheap materials.Automobile Magazine: By Design, Robert Cumberford, December 2006 issue[http://money.cnn.com/2006/10/02/autos/saturn_aura/index.htm?postversion=2006100417 Saturn Aura aims high, scores big. CNN Money] The Aura XR's standard features included: automatic climate control, remote vehicle start, [[Stabilitrak]] stability control, backseat audio controls, heated seats, six airbags, [[Anti-lock braking system|ABS]] four-wheel disc brakes, steering wheel audio controls, universal home remote, [[OnStar]] and a "Driver Information Center". ==Models== ===Aura XR=== [[File:Saturn Aura XR -- 08-28-2009.jpg|thumb|right|250px|2009 Saturn Aura XR]] The Aura XR was the top-line Aura model. The XR was fitted with the 3.6 L [[DOHC]] V6 with VVT, rated at {{convert|252|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} at 6200 rpm and {{convert|251|lbft|Nm|abbr=on}} of torque at 3100 rpm. This engine was first used in the [[Cadillac CTS]] as well as the [[Cadillac STS]] and marks its third use in a North American GM car. With this 3.6 L engine, the Aura was the first [[front-wheel drive]] GM passenger car to use the new Hydra-Matic 6T70 six-speed automatic transmission. The transmission featured TAPshift, which allowed the driver to manually select gears by using paddles located behind the steering wheel.{{cite web|url=http://www.saturnfans.com/Cars/AURA/2007/auraxeequipment.shtml|title=Saturn Aura Standard and optional equipment|accessdate=2007-03-17}} The Aura XR was the performance-oriented version with a taut, but not harsh, suspension and the more powerful engine. Available interior colors in the XR were tan and grey leather (available in the XE), along with the XR-specific black or Morocco Brown leather. Cloth was standard. Other standard features included the Advanced Audio Package, 18 inch alloy wheels, chrome exterior door handles, and remote vehicle start.{{cite web|url=http://www.saturn.com/saturn/vehicles/aura/pricing.jsp|title=Saturn Aura equipment|accessdate=2008-02-05|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080215055755/http://www.saturn.com/saturn/vehicles/aura/pricing.jsp|archivedate=2008-02-15}} Given the 2007 Saturn Aura's European roots—the car's chassis was also used for the Saab 9-3. The Aura also used hydraulic power steering (V-6 models only) that provided more feedback and a more linear feel than the fussy electric power-assist units. For 2009, an entry level XR became available. It included the 17 inch 10 spoke alloy wheels available on the XE and the 2.4 L [[GM Ecotec engine#LE5|LE5 Ecotec]] engine mated to GM's all new [[GM 6T40 transmission|6T40]] 6-speed automatic transmission with TAPshift. The 3.6L VVT with 18" wheels was optional. ===Aura XE=== [[File:2007 Saturn Aura XE.jpg|250px|thumb|right|2007 Saturn Aura XE]] The base version was the Aura XE. Equipped with the 3.5 L VVT V6 ([[GM High Value engine#LZ4|LZ4]]), the engine was matched with the 4T45-E four-speed automatic transmission. In the Aura, the engine produced {{convert|219|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|220|lbft|Nm|abbr=on}} of torque.[http://www.leftlanenews.com/2007-saturn-aura-unveiled.html Saturn Aura unveiled] Traction Control, six airbags, V6, automatic, auto headlights, CD with AUX, 17 inch wheels, among other features, comes standard. The Aura XE had a softer suspension, but still handled very well. A Special Edition version of the XE included equipment upgrades, the option of the XR-only black or Morocco Brown leather, along with new, XE-only 18 inch machined alloy wheels. Beginning with the 2008 model, the 2.4 L [[GM Ecotec engine#LE5|LE5 Ecotec]] 4-cylinder became available with the [[GM 4T45-E transmission|4T45-E]] 4-speed automatic. For 2009 the standard 4-cylinder was mated to GM's all new [[GM 6T40 transmission|6T40]] 6-speed automatic with TAPshift as standard equipment. This improved overall performance and increased fuel economy to {{convert|22|mpgus|L/100 km mpgimp}} in the city, and {{convert|33|mpgus|L/100 km mpgimp}} on the highway, up from the 2008's {{convert|22|mpgus|L/100 km mpgimp}} city, {{convert|30|mpgus|L/100 km mpgimp}} highway{{cite web | authorlink =http://www.eere.energy.gov/ | title =Fuel Economy | publisher =U.S. Department of Energy | url =http://www.fueleconomy.gov/feg/2008car1tablef.jsp?id=24397 | accessdate =2007-08-03}} ===Aura Green Line=== [[File:AuraGreenLine.JPG|thumb|right|250px|2007 Saturn Aura Green Line]] The Aura Green Line was a [[mild hybrid]], following the [[Saturn Vue|Vue]] Green Line as the second vehicle in Saturn's lineup incorporating GM's [[belt alternator starter]] system. It rode on the XE's suspension.[http://www.greencarcongress.com/2006/04/gm_saturn_aura_.html Green Car Congress: Saturn Aura Green Line] It was sold from late March 2007 to 2010.{{cite web |url=http://www.edmunds.com/insideline/do/News/articleId=120024 |title=Saturn Announces Pricing on Aura Green Line Hybrid |accessdate=2007-03-26 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070927192520/http://www.edmunds.com/insideline/do/News/articleId%3D120024 |archivedate=2007-09-27 }} As in the Vue, the Aura Green Line was equipped with the 2.4L [[GM Ecotec engine|Ecotec]] engine mated to an electric motor/generator and the 4T45-E four-speed automatic transmission. The powertrain was rated at {{convert|164|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|159|lbft|Nm|abbr=on}} of torque. The electric motor/generator augmented the gasoline engine during launch and under wide-open throttle. The Aura Green Line had an EPA estimated fuel economy of {{convert|26|mpgus|L/100 km mpgimp|abbr=on}} city and {{convert|34|mpgus|L/100 km mpgimp|abbr=on}} highway (for the 2007-08 model years it was {{convert|28|mpgus|L/100 km mpgimp|abbr=on}} city and {{convert|36|mpgus|L/100 km mpgimp|abbr=on}}), which Saturn claimed was up to a 30% improvement over the Aura XE.{{cite web|url=http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewmonthlyreleasedetail.do?domain=74&docid=34380 |title=GM Media Online - Saturn Aura Green Line |accessdate=2007-03-20 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20071015104356/http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewmonthlyreleasedetail.do%3Fdomain=74&docid=34380 |archivedate=2007-10-15 |url-status=dead }} The Saturn Aura Green Line was eligible for a $1300 US Federal tax credit, as well as several state tax credits.{{cite news| url=https://www.reuters.com/article/tnBasicIndustries-SP/idUSN1929812320070319 | title=GM's Saturn Aura hybrid gets ,300 tax credit | first=Jui | last=Chakravorty | date=2007-03-19 | work=Reuters}} Prior to the shutdown of Saturn, General Motors said that they would introduce a new hybrid system in summer 2010.[http://www.nbcnews.com/id/31249072 "GM cancels Chevy Malibu, Saturn Aura hybrids"]. [[Associated Press]]. June 11, 2009. ===Recall=== On September 21, 2012. General Motors recalled 473,841 vehicles involving the [[Chevy Malibu]], [[Pontiac G6]] and Saturn Aura from model years 2007 through 2010 equipped with four-speed automatic transmissions. The problem is a condition that could make cars roll when in park. The recall affects 426,240 in the United States, 40,029 in Canada and 7,572 in other markets.{{cite web|last=Klayman|first=Ben|title=GM recalls nearly 474,000 cars over gear shift problem|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/09/21/us-gm-usrecall-idUSBRE88K0II20120921|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=21 September 2012}} ==Engines== {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- !Trim!!Engine!!Displacement!!Power!!Torque!!Transmission!!Fuel Mileage

(2007–09)||3.6 L ''[[GM High Feature engine#LY7|LY7]]'' DOHC V6||{{convert|3564|cc|cuin|0|abbr=on}}||252 hp (186 kW)||{{convert|251|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}}||6-speed ''[[GM 6T70 transmission|6T70]]''||'''17''' city, '''26''' hwy, '''20''' comb |} ==Reception== Reception to the Aura was generally positive. The Aura was described as the best looking sedan to come out of GM in quite a while.[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QPcxcJjzxDY Fuel Show review of the Saturn Aura] The Aura was also praised for its performance.{{Cite web |url=http://autos.msn.com/research/vip/job.aspx?year=2007&make=Saturn&model=Aura |title=Ann Job review of the Saturn Aura. autos.msn.com |access-date=2007-03-17 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071106093855/http://autos.msn.com/research/vip/job.aspx?year=2007&make=Saturn&model=Aura |archive-date=2007-11-06 |url-status=dead }} The Aura has been described as "the best Saturn yet",{{Cite web |url=http://autos.msn.com/research/vip/jedlicka.aspx?year=2007&make=Saturn&model=Aura |title=Dan Jedlicka's reviews of the Saturn Aura |access-date=2007-03-17 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080107030745/http://autos.msn.com/research/vip/jedlicka.aspx?year=2007&make=Saturn&model=Aura |archive-date=2008-01-07 |url-status=dead }} and fit and finish and ride quality are regarded as greatly improved over previous Saturns. Other improvements include reduced road noise, attributed to the fact that this model doesn't use polymer body panels like its predecessors, in addition to the extensive soundproofing GM added to car, and the triple-pane front windows and windshield. The Aura also garnered praise for its value, as it was noted that an Aura XE loaded up with certain options cost less at the time than the standard MSRP of the [[Toyota Camry]] with a V6. The Aura finished fourth out of six places in a ''[[Car and Driver]]'' comparison test, ahead of the [[Chrysler Sebring]] and the [[Toyota Camry]], but fell behind the [[Honda Accord]].[http://www.caranddriver.com/comparisons/12148/2007-chrysler-sebring-touring-vs-2007-honda-accord-se-vs-2007-kia-optima-ex-vs-2007-nissan-altima-25s-vs-2007-saturn-aura-xe-vs-2007-toyota-camry-le.html Familial Four Doors: Car and Driver mid size sedan comparison] Despite this, it was the best performing out of the cars compared. The Aura also got praise for the craftsmanship of its interior and its European flair.[http://www.thecarconnection.com/Vehicle_Reviews/Sedans_Coupes_and_Hatchbacks/2007_Saturn_Aura.S180.A10775.html The Car Connection: Saturn Aura review] The Aura also got a favorable review by Consumer Guide, with it being a recommended pick.[http://consumerguideauto.howstuffworks.com/2007-saturn-aura-1.htm Consumer Guide road test of the Saturn Aura] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070410141332/http://consumerguideauto.howstuffworks.com/2007-saturn-aura-1.htm |date=2007-04-10 }} It also got more than favorable reviews from actual owners of the vehicle.{{cite web|url=http://autos.msn.com/research/userreviews/reviewlist.aspx?modelid=12079&trimid=-1|title=MSN autos user reviews: Saturn Aura|accessdate=2007-03-17|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110717073851/http://autos.msn.com/research/userreviews/reviewlist.aspx?modelid=12079&trimid=-1|archive-date=2011-07-17|url-status=dead}} Despite this, the Aura has a few criticisms. The Aura's interior has been criticized for using cheap materials. Also, the steering wheel has been criticized for being too big for some drivers and that rear headroom was tight when equipped with the optional sunroof. The Aura was also criticized for being noisy over bumps and its lack of a rear armrest and head restraint, and that the push button controls on the steering wheel cannot be operated while holding the wheel. Robert Cumberford of [[Automobile (magazine)|''Autombile'' magazine]] claimed that the Aura is a good car watered down by GM's cost cutting department. ===Awards=== The Aura won the [[North American Car of the Year]] prize for 2007.{{cite web|url=http://autoweek.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20070107/FREE/70107002/1056/autoshows|title=One-two punch, GM sweeps North American awards|accessdate=2007-03-17}} As a result, Saturn sent a copy of the award to select customers who bought an Aura before it was awarded.{{cite web|url=http://www.saturnfans.com/Cars/AURA/2007/oscarauraad.shtml|title=Saturn Aura Academy Award ad|accessdate=2007-03-17}} The Aura also won Canadian's Motoring Television's 2007 car of the year award,[http://www.saturnfans.com/Cars/Aura/2007/auravotedbest.shtml Saturnfans.com: Saturn Aura awards]''Motorweek''{{'}}s Driver's Choice for best new midsize sedan, and ''World of Wheels''{{'}} Editor's Choice for best family sedan. ==Yearly American sales== {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! Calendar Year ! Total American sales |- | 2006 | 19,746 |- | 2007{{cite web|url=http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewpressreldetail.do?domain=2&docid=51161 |title=GM Media Online |publisher=Media.gm.com |date=2009-01-05 |accessdate=2009-05-01 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20090423151551/http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewpressreldetail.do%3Fdomain=2&docid=51161 |archivedate=April 23, 2009 }} | 59,964 |- | 2008 | 59,380 |- | 2009http://media.gm.com/content/Pages/news/us/en/2010/Jan/0105_Dec_Sales/_jcr_content/iconrow/textfile/file.res/Deliveries%20December%2009.xls | 21,395 |} ==See also== *[[List of hybrid vehicles]] ==References== *{{cite web |url=http://www.saturn.com/saturn/vehicles/aura/overview.jsp |title=Saturn Aura official website |work=saturn.com |accessdate=2006-08-24 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060826032224/http://www.saturn.com/saturn/vehicles/aura/overview.jsp |archivedate=2006-08-26 }} *{{cite web|url=http://onlocation.consumerreports.org/new-york-auto-show/2-Model.asp?ID=190|title=Saturn Aura auto show unveiling|work=consumerreports.org|accessdate=2006-08-24}} *{{cite web|url=http://www.edmunds.com/saturn/aura/2007/#fullreview|title=Edmunds Review 2007 Saturn Aura|work=edmunds.com| accessdate=2011-01-15}} ==Notes== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== {{commons category}} {{Saturn Corporation}} [[Category:Saturn vehicles|Aura]] [[Category:Front-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:Mid-size cars]] [[Category:Sedans]] [[Category:2000s cars]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 2006]] [[Category:Hybrid electric cars]] [[Category:Motor vehicles manufactured in the United States]]

{{Refimprove|date=September 2007}} {{Infobox automobile | name = Saturn Outlook | image = Saturn Outlook -- 03-24-2012.JPG | manufacturer = [[General Motors]] | production = 2006–2010 | model_years = 2007–2010 | assembly = Lansing-Delta Township Assembly in [[Delta Township, Michigan]], [[United States]] | class = [[Full-size]] [[crossover SUV]] | body_style = 4-door [[sport utility vehicle|SUV]] | platform = [[GM Lambda platform]]/GMT966 (Series GMT960) | related = [[Buick Enclave]]
[[GMC Acadia]]
[[Chevrolet Traverse]] | layout = [[Front-engine, front-wheel-drive layout|Transverse front-engine, front-wheel drive]] / [[Front-engine, all-wheel-drive layout|all-wheel drive]] | engine = 3.6 L ''[[GM High Feature engine#LY7|LY7]]''  [[V6]]
3.6 L ''[[GM High Feature engine#LLT|LLT]]''  V6 | transmission = 6-speed ''[[GM 6T70 transmission|6T70]]'' [[automatic transmission|automatic]] | wheelbase = {{convert|118.9|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|200.7|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|78.2|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|69.9|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | predecessor = [[Saturn Relay]] | successor = [[Chevrolet Traverse]]
[[GMC Acadia]] }} [[File:Saturn Outlook rear 5.6.18.jpg|thumb|right|Saturn Outlook rear]] The '''Saturn Outlook''' is a [[full-size]] [[crossover SUV]] that debuted at the [[New York International Auto Show]], and was based on the [[GM Lambda platform]], which it shared with the [[Buick Enclave]], [[Chevrolet Traverse]] and [[GMC Acadia]]. The Outlook went on sale in 2006 as a 2007 model. The Outlook featured the lowest sticker price among GM's Lambda [[crossover (automobile)|crossover SUV]]s, slotting below the [[GMC Acadia]] and [[Buick Enclave]]. The Chevrolet Traverse would ultimately take the place of the Outlook as the family-oriented model following the introduction of the Traverse for the 2009 model year, and the demise of the Outlook, along with the rest of the Saturn brand in 2010, with the 2010 model year being the final model year for the Outlook. The Saturn Outlook was discontinued after the 2010 model year. Following the withdrawal of a bid by [[Penske Automotive Group|Penske Automotive]] to acquire [[Saturn Corporation|Saturn]], the [[Motors Liquidation Company]] of [[General Motors]] announced in September 2009 that it would phase out the Saturn brand by October 31, 2010, when it ceased operations.{{cite web|author=Reuters |date=September 30, 2009 |url=https://montrealgazette.com/wind+down+Saturn+brand+October+2010/2052163/story.html |title=GM to wind down Saturn brand by October 2010 |publisher=Montrealgazette.com |accessdate=2009-10-07 }}{{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} The GM logos were applied on the front doors of the Outlook; the GM logo had stopped being applied on the Outlook in 2010, but the GM logo was applied on the early 2010 Outlook models. ==Driveline== The Outlook was powered by the 3.6 L [[V6]] [[DOHC]] [[Multi-valve|24-valve]] [[GM High Feature engine|HFV6 engine]] with [[Variable Valve Timing]], available with either single or dual exhaust. Both versions use the [[Hydra-Matic]] [[GM-Ford 6-speed automatic transmission|6T75]] six-speed [[automatic transmission]], and available with either [[front-wheel drive]] or [[all-wheel drive]]. {| class=wikitable |- !Year!!Exhaust!!Engine!!Power!!Torque!!Transmission |- |rowspan=2|2007–2008||Single||3.6 L ''[[GM High Feature engine#LY7|LY7]]'' [[V6]]||270 hp (198 kW)||248 lb·ft (331 N·m)||rowspan=4|6-speed ''[[GM 6T75 transmission|6T75]]'' |- ||Dual||3.6 L ''[[GM High Feature engine#LY7|LY7]]'' [[V6 engine|V6]]||275 hp (199 kW)||251 lb·ft (335 N·m) |- |rowspan=2|2009||Single||3.6 L ''[[GM High Feature engine#LLT|LLT]]'' [[V6 engine|V6]]||281 hp (210 kW)||266 lb·ft (361 N·m) |- ||Dual||3.6 L ''[[GM High Feature engine#LLT|LLT]]'' [[V6 engine|V6]]||288 hp (215 kW)||270 lb·ft (366 N·m) |} ==Yearly American sales== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Sales |- | 2006 | 144 |- | 2007 | 34,748 |- | 2008{{cite press|date=January 3, 2008 |publisher=GM |title=GM Reports 323,453 December Deliveries; 3.87 Million Vehicles Sold in 2007 |url=http://archives.media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewpressreldetail.do?domain=3&docid=42261 }}{{dead link|date=November 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} | 25,340 |- | 2009http://media.gm.com/content/Pages/news/us/en/2010/Jan/0105_Dec_Sales/_jcr_content/iconrow/textfile/file.res/Deliveries%20December%2009.xls | 13,115 |- | 2010 | 3,637GM did not report sales of individual models for the discontinued brands after January 2010. |} ==Seating configuration== The Outlook can seat eight in a three-row setting. The front row consists of two [[bucket seat]]s, and the second row is available as either a 60/40 split-folding three-passenger [[bench seat]] or two individual "captain chairs." The third row is a 60/40 split-folding three-passenger bench seat. In the press release accompanying the Outlook's launch, GM emphasized the "industry first" ''SmartSlide'' second row. In case of both bench seat or captain chairs, the seat cushion flips forward while the seat is being slid forward, which allows for "compression" of the space used by the seat in the foremost position. If the third seat is folded, this allows for expansion of the cargo area. The system also allows for fore-aft adjustment of the middle seat to change the spacing between the second and third-row seats for more legroom. ==Production== The Outlook, along with the other Lambda-based vehicles, was built in the [[Delta Township Assembly]] plant near [[Lansing, Michigan]]. Production on the Saturn Outlook and its twin the GMC Acadia had both began on May 24, 2006 for the 2007 model year. In December 2006, all production and sales of the Outlook (and the GMC Acadia) were temporarily stopped due to the engine mounts not having holes drilled to release accumulated water, as well as an issue with potentially faulty rivets in the load floor just forward of the rear hatch. The assembly process was quickly adjusted, and dealerships were told to fix the problems themselves before offering the Outlook (or the Acadia) for sale again. Sales resumed within days of the notice. Production of the Outlook was halted in late 2009. However, in February 2010 GM resumed production of the Outlook to use up remaining parts prior to the closing of the Saturn division. It is not known how or where they were sold.http://www.autoweek.com/article/20100316/CARNEWS/100319901 3,637 2010 model year Outlooks were built, 2,507 of them were assembled in the calendar year of 2010. Following its discontinuation, the bodyshell of the Outlook was revived as a mid-cycle refresh of the 2013 [[GMC Acadia]]. The bodyshell of the 2013 Acadia was mostly unchanged from the Saturn Outlook, GM had only made changes to the 2013 Acadia where necessary. ==Crash test ratings== [[National Highway Traffic Safety Administration]] (NHTSA): Frontal: [[File:5 stars.svg|70px]] Side: [[File:5 stars.svg|70px]] The Outlook was an [[Insurance Institute for Highway Safety]] Top Safety Pick for 2008 and 2009.{{cite web |url=http://www.iihs.org/ratings/tsp_archive_2008.html |title=Top Safety Picks 2008 |publisher=Insurance Institute for Highway Safety |accessdate=2009-12-23 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091223064406/http://www.iihs.org/ratings/tsp_archive_2008.html |archivedate=2009-12-23 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.iihs.org/ratings/tsp_archive.html |title=Top Safety Picks 2009 |publisher=Insurance Institute for Highway Safety |accessdate=2009-12-23 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070520111723/http://www.iihs.org/ratings/tsp_archive.html |archivedate=2007-05-20 }} ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category|Saturn Outlook}} *[https://web.archive.org/web/20070128080856/http://www.saturn.com/saturn/vehicles/outlook/overview.jsp Official site] *{{cite press|publisher=GM|date=April 11, 2006|url=http://archives.media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://www.theautochannel.com/news/2006/04/12/003753.html |title=Saturn Has An All-New Outlook}} *[http://www.iihs.org/ratings/default.aspx IIHS Top Safety Picks 2008] {{Saturn Corporation}} [[Category:All-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:Mid-size sport utility vehicles]] [[Category:Crossover sport utility vehicles]] [[Category:Front-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:Saturn vehicles|Outlook]] [[Category:2000s cars]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 2006]] [[Category:Vehicles built in Lansing, Michigan]] [[Category:Motor vehicles manufactured in the United States]]

{{convert|55.6|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} (Red Line) |weight = {{convert|2600|-|2984|lb|kg|0|abbr=on}}{{cite web|last=Swan|first=Tony|title=Saturn Ion Red Line|url=http://www.caranddriver.com/reviews/saturn-ion-red-line-first-drive-review|work=Car and Driver|publisher=[[Car and Driver]]|accessdate=26 March 2013|date=December 2003}}{{cite web|last=Quiroga|first=Tony|title=Saturn Ion Red Line|url=http://www.caranddriver.com/reviews/saturn-ion-red-line-short-take-road-test-specs-page-2|work=Car and Driver|publisher=[[Car and Driver]]|accessdate=26 March 2013|date=October 2004}} |predecessor = [[Saturn S-Series]] |successor = [[Saturn Astra]] }} The '''Saturn Ion''' was a [[compact car]] sold by [[Saturn Corporation|Saturn]] between the 2003 and 2007 model years. It used the [[GM Delta platform]]. The Ion replaced the [[Saturn S-Series]] in 2002,{{cite press release | title = GM Hopes to Win over Drivers with Saturn Ion | publisher = [[Detroit Free Press]] | date = 2002-10-31 | url = http://www.accessmylibrary.com/coms2/summary_0286-8956273_ITM | accessdate = 2008-09-20 }} and was replaced by the new [[Saturn Astra]] in 2008. Production of the Ion ended on March 29, 2007. ==History== ===2003–2004=== [[File:Saturn Ion coupe -- 11-5-2011.jpg|left|thumb|2005–2007 Saturn Ion coupe]] [[File:Saturn ION silver 4-door coupe doors.jpg|thumb|left|Clamshell doors]] The 2003 Saturn Ion [[quad coupe]] production car first appeared at the 2002 [[New York International Auto Show]]. The 2003 Ion came standard with a 2.2 [[Litre|L]] {{Convert|140|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} [[DOHC]] [[Ecotec]] [[I4 engine]]. The Ion's instrument panel was mounted on the top center of the dashboard, rather than behind the steering wheel. The Ion is also available in [[Sedan (car)|sedan]] level 1, 2, or 3; level three signified a more user friendly setup with power windows and power locks, while lower levels included crank windows and plastic wheel covers. Other extras included fog lights, sunroof, and spoiler. The Saturn Ion Quad Coupe has half-sized rear [[Suicide door#Modern use|clamshell doors]] while the sedan has conventionally hinged doors. A [[Getrag F23 transmission|Getrag F23]] 5-speed manual or an [[Aisin AF23 transmission|Aisin AF23]] 5-speed [[automatic transmission]] were available. The compact 5-speed automatic had several unique characteristics. The [[transmission (mechanics)|transmission]] lacked an overdrive, allowing for five forward gears to be packaged in the size of a typical four-speed manual gearbox, both providing close gear ratios for better acceleration and fuel efficiency while eliminating the heat and parasitic loss generated by the additional planetary gearset. The unit was also “fill-for-life”, meaning that it was not intended to be serviced for the life of the vehicle. The 2003 and 2004 Ion Coupes were available with the [[VTi transmission|VTi]] [[continuously variable transmission]] or a [[Getrag F23 transmission|Getrag F23]] 5-speed manual. For 2004, Saturn also re-calibrated the electric power steering, as well as upgraded interior materials, and offered new sound systems. ===2005–2006=== [[File:2005-Saturn-Ion-1.jpg|alt=|left|thumb|2005 Saturn Ion]] In 2005, the Aisin 5-speed automatic transmission was discontinued. The VTi CVT used in the quad-coupes between 2002 and 2004 was also discontinued. [[GM 4T45-E transmission|GM's 4-speed 4T45-E]] replaced both transmissions, becoming the only available automatic transmission option. The 2005 Ion sedan models also received a new steering wheel, the same one used in the 2004 Ion coupe models. In the middle of the 2005 model year, the seats in the base Ion1 model received upgraded fabrics and a height adjustment feature. "[[Quiet Steel]]" multilaminate sound-reduction technology was also introduced in 2005. Cosmetic changes included an upgraded fascia with a larger grille opening (2005-2007 Ion sedan models) and redesigned wheel covers and redesigned alloy wheel offerings. Under the hood, an acoustic engine cover was added to the engine bay to reduce noise emissions. The Level 2 and Level 3 models were offered with GM's new standard radio, featuring [[MP3]] playback. 2006 saw the {{Convert|170|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}}, {{convert|162|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} torque, 2.4 L [[I4 engine]] with [[variable valve timing]] become available for the Ion3. Along with that, the Ion was discontinued after the 2007 model year.{{cite web|url=http://www.cars.com/go/crp/research.jsp?makeid=43&mode=&revid=48452&year=2006&acode=&modelid=6768&revlogtype=21§ion=reviews&crpPage=summary.jsp&myid=§ion=reviews&mode=&aff=national|title=2006 Saturn Ion Overview|publisher=Cars.com|date=2005-08-02 |accessdate=2009-10-07}} ===2007=== [[File:Ion1.jpg|left|thumb|2007 Saturn Ion 3 Quad Coupe]] The 2.2-liter Ecotec engine in the 2007 Saturn Ion was improved over the previous year's model: power output increased from {{Convert|140|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} to {{Convert|145|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} at 5600 rpm, and torque output increased from {{Convert|145|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} to {{Convert|150|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} at 4200 rpm. The new engine was fitted with the ECU from the 2.4-liter engine. The 2.4-liter Ecotec received a similar upgrade: power increased from {{Convert|170|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} to {{Convert|175|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} at 6500 rpm, and torque increased from {{Convert|162|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} to {{Convert|164|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} at 4800 [[Revolutions per minute|rpm]]. An "Appearance Package" was offered for the 2007 Ion 3 Quad Coupe, including redesigned front and rear bumpers, side moldings, elliptical [[fog lamps]], and a chrome exhaust tip. The [[Recaro]] seats in the Red Line version were replaced with black leather-appointed seats, which featured a [[passenger]]-sensing system. The Ion was discontinued after the 2007 model year, and replaced in Saturn's lineup by the [[Saturn Astra]] [[hatchback]], a [[Badge engineering|rebadged]] [[Opel Astra H]] imported from [[Belgium]].{{cite press release | title = Ion makes room for the Astra | publisher = San Francisco Chronicle | date = 2007-03-10 | url = http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2007/03/10/MTGM4OI2NT1.DTL | accessdate = 2008-09-20 }} The Ion was the last Saturn built at the Spring Hill, Tennessee plant.http://www.automobilemag.com/news/saturn-timeline-1982-to-2009/ === Red Line Edition === [[File:Saturn-Ion-RedLine.jpg|200px|thumb|left|Saturn Ion Red Line]]In production from 2004 through the 2007 Model Year, Saturn produced the '''Red Line''' [[Sport compact|Sport Compact]]{{cite web|last=Cole |first=Steven |url=http://www.signonsandiego.com/uniontrib/20051015/news_lz1d15saturn.html |title=Saturn's Ion Red Line offers fun, good mileage | The San Diego Union-Tribune |publisher=Signonsandiego.com |date=2005-10-15 |accessdate=2015-03-31}}{{cite press release | title = Saturn Announces Ion Red Line Pricing | publisher = GM Media Online | date = 2004-03-30 | url = http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewmonthlyreleasedetail.do?domain=35&docid=3012 | accessdate = 2009-10-06 }} This engine/powertrain combination is also shared with the [[Chevrolet Cobalt SS#SS Supercharged|Chevy Cobalt SS Supercharged Edition]], which did not start production until the 2005 model year. The Ion Red Line features most interior features from the standard Ion Coupe, including its rear [[Suicide door#Modern use|clamshell doors]], to allow accessibility to the rear seat.{{cite web|url=http://www.caranddriver.com/reviews/comparisons/05q3/acura_rsx_type-s_vs._chevy_cobalt_ss_supercharged_dodge_srt4_acr_saturn_ion_red_line_subaru_impreza_wrx-comparison_tests/saturn_ion_red_line_page_6 |title=Saturn Ion Red Line |publisher=John Phillips, Caranddriver.com|date=September 2005 |accessdate=2009-10-08}} Introduced for the 2005 model year was the optional Competition Package. Included in the Competition Package were 17" Gunmetal Painted Alloy Rims, Ladder [[Tachometer]] w/ shift lights, a [[Differential (mechanical device)|Limited Slip Differential]], and Optional Projector-beam Fog Lamps.{{cite web|url=http://www.edmunds.com/used/2006/saturn/ion/100595788/standard.html|title=2006 Saturn Ion Specs|publisher=Edmunds.com|year=2006 |accessdate=2009-10-08}} In mid-2006, GM released two Engine Kit upgrades for both the Ion Red Line and the Cobalt SS. The Stage 1 Kit retailed for around US$500, and included higher-flow fuel injectors and a recalibration to the [[Engine control unit|ECU]] to increase the [[horsepower]] by {{Convert|31|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} to {{Convert|236|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{Convert|205|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of [[torque]], up from the stock {{Convert|205|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{Convert|200|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}}. The Stage 2 Kit retailed for around $750 and opens up the middle of the power curve to more power than the Stage 1 Kit alone. In addition to everything that the Stage 1 Kit comes with, the Stage 2 Kit includes a smaller drive belt and pulley for the supercharger, bringing the engine up to {{Convert|241|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{Convert|218|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque. GM did release a Stage 1 to Stage 2 Upgrade kit that retailed for $400. This Upgrade Kit is for a Red Line with the Stage 1 kit already installed. This Upgrade Kit adds the Stage 2 elements and increases the horsepower from {{Convert|236|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} to {{Convert|241|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}}.{{cite web|url=http://www.leftlanenews.com/gm-announces-superchargers-for-cobalt-ss-ion-redline.html|title=GM Announces Supercharger Upgrades for Cobalt SS, Ion Red Line |publisher=Admin, leftlanenews.com|date=2006-04-06 |accessdate=2009-10-08}} On October 17, 2003 at the [[Bonneville Salt Flats]] in Utah, the Saturn Ion Red Line, piloted by the GM Performance Division's "Saturn Land Speed Record Project" set a new land-speed record in the "G/Blown Fuel Altered" Class at 212.684 mph. This exceeded the previous record of 183.086 mph that was set in 2001.{{cite press release | title = Saturn ION Red Line Sets Speed Record | publisher = Worldcarfans.com | date = 2004-10-21 | url = http://www.worldcarfans.com/104102110111/saturn-ion-red-line-sets-speed-record | accessdate = 2009-10-06 }} Below are the Production Numbers for the Ion Red Line from 2004 to 2007.{{cite web|url=http://www.redlineforums.com/forums/ion-redline-discussion/14991-redline-production-s-would-like-help.html|title=2006 Red Line Production Numbers|publisher=redlineforums.com|year=2006 |accessdate=2009-10-08}} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Pkg. | 0 | 118 | 641 | 337 | 1096 |} ===Discontinuation=== [[File:Saturn Ion rear 4.11.18.jpg|thumb|right|Rear view]] [[General Motors]] decided to discontinue the Ion after the 2007 model year. It was replaced by the 2008 Astra. The Astra shares the Delta platform with the Ion, but is a captive import from Opel. While Opel offered the Astra in multiple body types, and with other performance options, Saturn did not import any of them – the Astra was only offered with a single base engine, and in 3-door and 5-door hatchback bodystyles only, in two trim levels. ==Safety== ===Insurance Institute for Highway Safety (IIHS)=== {| class="wikitable" |+2003–2007 Ion [[Insurance Institute for Highway Safety|IIHS]] scores{{cite web|url=http://www.iihs.org/iihs/ratings/vehicle/v/saturn/ion-4-door-sedan |title=IIHS-HLDI: Saturn ION |publisher=Iihs.org |date= |accessdate=2015-12-29}} |- |Moderate overlap frontal offset||Acceptable |- |Small overlap frontal offset||Not Tested |- |Side impact||Poor |- |Roof strength||Not Tested |} IIHS only tested the 4-door sedan version. {{Infobox automobile | name = Saturn Vue | image = 2008 Saturn Vue XE.jpg |manufacturer = [[Saturn Corporation]] (2002-2007)
[[Opel]] ([[General Motors]]) (2008-2010) | production = 2001–2009 | model_years = 2002–2010 | class = [[Compact SUV]] | body_style = 5-door [[SUV]] | related = [[Pontiac Torrent]] [[Chevrolet Equinox]] | layout = [[Front-engine, front-wheel-drive layout|Transverse front-engine, front-wheel drive]] / [[Front-engine, all-wheel-drive layout|all-wheel drive]] | predecessor = [[Isuzu MU|Isuzu Rodeo]] (Canada)
[[Chevrolet Tracker (Americas)|Geo/Chevrolet Tracker]] | successor = [[Opel Antara|Chevrolet Captiva Sport]] }} The '''Saturn Vue''' is a [[compact SUV]] that was sold and built by [[Saturn Corporation|Saturn]], and it was Saturn's best-selling model. It was the first vehicle to use the [[GM Theta platform]] when it was introduced in 2001 for the 2002 model year. The Vue was later facelifted for the 2006 model year. A second generation model was launched in 2007 for the 2008 model year as a rebadged [[Opel Antara]]. The Vue production in North America ended as GM wound down the Saturn brand during its [[General Motors Chapter 11 reorganization|2009 reorganization]]. __TOC__ {{clear}} == First generation (2002–2007) == {{Infobox automobile | name = First generation | image = Saturn VUE 1234 (cropped).JPG | production = 2001–2007 | model_years = 2002–2007 | assembly = [[Spring Hill, Tennessee]], United States ([[Spring Hill Manufacturing]]) | class = [[Compact SUV]] | body_style = 5-door [[sport utility vehicle|SUV]] | platform = [[GM Theta platform]] | engine = {{ubl |2.2 L ''[[GM Ecotec engine#L61|L61]]'' [[inline-four engine|I4]] ([[gasoline]])|2.4 L ''[[GM Ecotec engine#LAT|LAT]]'' ([[hybrid electric vehicle|hybrid]] gasoline / electric)|3.0 L ''[[General Motors 54° V6 engine#L81|L81]]'' [[V6]] (gasoline)|3.5 L ''[[Honda_J_engine#J35A|L66]]'' [[V6]] (gasoline)}} | transmission = {{ubl |4-speed ''[[GM_4T45-E_transmission#4T45|GM 4T45-E]]'' automatic|5-speed ''[[Aisin AF33 transmission|Aisin AF33]]'' automatic|5-speed ''[[Honda H5 transmission|Honda H5]]'' automatic|5-speed ''[[Getrag F23 transmission|Getrag F23]]'' manual|[[continuously variable transmission|CVT]] ''[[VTi transmission|VTi]]'' automatic}} | wheelbase = {{convert|106.6|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|181.3|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|71.5|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
Hybrid: {{convert|71.6|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|66.5|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
Hybrid: {{convert|66.3|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} }} The Vue was introduced for the 2002 model year and was designed by Saturn. It was manufactured at the [[Spring Hill, Tennessee|Spring Hill]] GM plant. Its unibody platform is shared with the [[Chevrolet Equinox]], [[Pontiac Torrent]] and the [[Europe]]an [[Opel Antara]]. The first generation ran from model year 2002-2007. [[File:03 Saturn Vue (6676845529).jpg|thumb|left|2003 Saturn Vue rear]] Four-cylinder Vues use the ''[[GM Ecotec engine|Ecotec]]'' [[inline-four engine|I4]]. The ''[[GM 54-Degree V6 engine#L81|L81]]'' [[V6]] from the [[Saturn L-Series|L-Series]] and five-speed [[Aisin AF33 transmission|Aisin AF33]] [[automatic transmission]] were initially offered, but starting in 2004, all six-cylinder Vues were equipped with [[Honda]]'s {{convert|250|hp|kW|adj=on}} ''[[Honda_J_engine#J35A|J35A3]]'' engine and a [[Honda]] transmission. The four-cylinder Vue was available with the [[VTi transmission|VTi]] [[continuously variable transmission]] (CVT) until GM canceled it for 2005 due to dependability issues. The Vue received a facelift for the 2006 model year. Upgrades included a redesigned interior with higher-quality materials, a new bumper and grille, and some minor cosmetic pieces to the exterior. [[OnStar]] is now standard as well as [[cruise control]] and automatic headlights. However, GM badges were not added to the side of the vehicle until GM took over production from Saturn for the second generation Vue. ===Model year changes=== In 2004: *The Vue Red Line was released *V6 models received Honda's J35S1 engine and Honda transmission. This 3.5 liter engine and 5 speed transmission boosted performance over the prior V-6. It was an important selling point at the time. This V-6 engine was used in the Saturn Vue 2004 to 2007 model years. In 2005: *5- and 4-speed automatic transmissions return for 2005, and the CVT is dropped. *All Vues get a redesigned interior critique with new air vents, new steering wheel, and a new radio faceplate which contributes [[noise, vibration, and harshness]]. In 2006: *Facelift with new interior, cosmetic changes to the exterior. === Red Line === [[File:Saturn Vue RedLine -- 10-31-2009.jpg|thumb|left|2004–2005 Saturn Vue Red Line]] Saturn introduced a special high-performance line of vehicles in 2004 under the name, "Red Line". The '''Vue Red Line''' includes the same {{convert|250|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} [[Honda]] ''[[Honda J engine|J35A3]]'' V6 as the regular model, but with sportier suspension tuning, lowered 1 inch, and unique power steering calibration for performance, 18 in alloy wheels, ground-effect front and rear bumpers, unique rocker panel trim, chrome exhaust tip, special black leather and suede seats (optional for 2005, standard for 2006 and 2007), footwell lighting (included with leather and suede seats package, not available with optional full-leather (heated front) seats), and a special gauge cluster complete the visual updates. It also includes some special interior features as well, such as a higher quality audio system."Saturn Vue". Advertisement brochure. Canada: General Motors Corporation and General Motors of Canada Limited, 2006, p.21 of 32. === Green Line === [[File:2007 Saturn Vue Green Line .jpg|thumb|right|Saturn Vue Green Line]] [[File:Argonne's Through-the-Road (TTR) Plug-in Hybrid prototype.jpg|thumb|right|Saturn Vue Green Line rear]] The high-performance Vue Red Line was joined for 2007 by an environmentally oriented '''Green Line''' model. The Vue is a [[mild hybrid]], or "assist hybrid", using what GM calls a "[[belt alternator starter]]" [[BAS Hybrid]] system.{{cite web|url=http://www.gm.com/company/gmability/adv_tech/300_hybrids/bas_050103.html |date=2003-11-11 |accessdate=2007-06-14 |title=GM - GMability Advanced Technology: GM's Belt Alternator Starter... - www.gm.com/company/gmability/adv_tech/300_hybrids |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061029110339/http://www.gm.com/company/gmability/adv_tech/300_hybrids/bas_050103.html |archivedate=October 29, 2006 }} A large electric motor is connected to the crankshaft via a special accessory drive belt, with a modified automatic transmission fitted. It automatically stops the engine when the vehicle comes to a halt and instantly restarts it when the vehicle must move again. Not to be confused as just a "start-stop" system, the electric motor also assists somewhat during initial launch, during torque smoothing and when under heavy acceleration. A 36-volt [[nickel metal hydride battery|nickel metal hydride]] (NiMH) battery pack, located under the load floor, powers the motor/generator unit and also stores regenerative braking energy. The regenerative charging and electric motor assist functions are shown to the driver via an analog gauge on the dash board, and real-time fuel-economy feedback is accomplished via an "eco" light that glows when the instantaneous fuel economy is beating the window sticker fuel economy values. The fuel savings are 20 percent up from the base vehicle's {{convert|22|mpgus|L/100 km|abbr=on}}/{{convert|27|mpgus|L/100 km|abbr=on}} city/highway EPA sticker to {{convert|27|mpgus|L/100 km|abbr=on}}/{{convert|32|mpgus|L/100 km|abbr=on}}, the highest highway fuel economy of any 2007 model SUV sold in the US market.2007 model EPA Highway rating of 32 mpg. In Canada, according to Saturn, the Vue gets an estimated {{convert|8.8|L/100 km|abbr=on}} city and {{convert|6.7|L/100 km|abbr=on}} highway."Saturn Vue". Advertisement brochure. Canada: General Motors Corporation and General Motors of Canada Limited, 2006, p.8 of 32. The Green Line has a {{convert|170|hp|kW|0|abbr=on|adj=on}} 2.4-liter ''[[GM Ecotec engine|Ecotec]]'' [[DOHC]]-phaser engine which replaces the standard {{convert|144|hp|kW|0|adj=on}} 2.2-liter inline-four engine, resulting in the improvement of {{convert|0|-|60|mph|km/h|abbr=on}} acceleration time by 1.0 second. Pricing for the hybrid is about US$2,000 more than a similarly equipped Vue, and debuted in production form on January 8, 2006 at the [[North American International Auto Show]] in [[Detroit]]. The Green Line went on sale in the third quarter of 2006. === Engines === {| class="wikitable" |- !Years !Engine !Power !Torque |- |2002–2007||2.2 [[Liter|L]] ''[[GM Ecotec engine#L61|Ecotec L61]]'' [[inline-four engine|I4]]||143 [[Horsepower|hp]] (107 [[Kilowatt|kW]])||152 [[Foot pound force|lb·ft]] (206 [[Newton metre|N·m]]) |- |2002–2003||3.0 L ''[[GM 54-Degree V6 engine|54-Degree]]'' [[V6]]||181 hp (135 kW)||195 lb·ft (264 N·m) |- |2004–2007||3.5 L ''[[GM L66 engine|GM L66]]'' ''([[Honda J engine|J35S1]])'' [[V6]]||250 hp (186 kW)||242 lb·ft (328 N·m) |- |2007-2010||2.4 L ''[[GM Ecotec engine#LE5|Ecotec LE5]]'' [[inline-four engine|I4]]||170 hp (127 kW)||163 lb·ft (220 N·m) |- |2008-2010||3.6 L ''[[GM High Feature engine#LY7|LY7]]'' [[V6]]||257 hp (192 kW)||248 lb·ft (336 N·m) |} === Safety === In [[Insurance Institute for Highway Safety]] (IIHS) crash tests the Vue receives a ''Good'' overall rating in the frontal offset crash test. In 2008 models came equipped with standard front and rear head side curtain airbags and front seat-mounted torso airbags. These models were given an ''acceptable'' overall rating in side impacts. Models without side airbags were given an overall ''poor'' rating.{{cite web | url = http://www.iihs.org/ratings/ratingsbyseries.aspx?id=446 | title = Saturn Vue | publisher = Iihs.org | accessdate = 2009-05-21 | url-status = dead | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20090607140804/http://www.iihs.org/ratings/ratingsbyseries.aspx?id=446 | archivedate = 2009-06-07 }} == Second generation (2008–2010) == {{Infobox automobile | name = Second generation | image = 2nd Saturn Vue -- 08-28-2009.jpg | manufacturer = [[Opel]] ([[General Motors]]) |aka=[[Opel Antara]]
Vauxhall Antara
[[Holden Captiva|Holden Captiva 5]]
GMC Terrain (Middle East)
Daewoo Winstorm MaXX
[[Chevrolet Captiva Sport]] | production = 2007–2009 | model_years = 2008–2010 | assembly = [[Ramos Arizpe]], Mexico | class = [[Compact SUV]] | body_style = 5-door [[sport utility vehicle|SUV]] | platform = [[GM Theta platform]] | related = [[Opel Antara|Chevrolet Captiva Sport]] | engine = | transmission = | length = | width = | height = }} {{Main|Opel Antara#Saturn Vue|l1=Opel Antara}} [[File:Saturn vue-2007washauto.jpg|thumb|left|Saturn Vue rear]] Saturn introduced the second generation Vue in 2007 for the 2008 model year, manufactured in Mexico as a rebranded version of the German-designed [[Opel Antara]]. Saturn offered four trim levels: base "XE", classier, up-level "XR", top of the line sporty "Red Line" and a "Green Line" hybrid trim. Available engines include a 2.4L inline 4 cylinder, as well as 3.5L and a 3.6L V6 options. A hybrid powertrain version of the 2.4-liter model was also available. GM badges were now added to the front doors. The Mexican-manufactured Vue was also retailed in Mexico and South America as the Chevrolet Captiva Sport, with only badges changed and a new grille insert fitted. Following the demise of the Saturn brand in 2009 for the 2010 model year, the Vue was discontinued.{{cite web | last1 = Johnson | first1 = Kimberly | last2 = Krisher | first2 = Tom | date = 1 October 2009 | url = http://www.boston.com/business/articles/2009/10/01/gm_to_phase_out_saturn_division/ | title = GM to phase out Saturn division | work = [[The Boston Globe]] | publisher = [[The New York Times Company]] | accessdate = 2011-03-12}} However, GM continued to produce the Chevrolet Captiva Sport, for the Mexican and South American markets. The Chevrolet Captiva Sport was introduced for the US commercial and fleet markets in late 2011 for the 2012 model year.{{cite web | last = Lassa | first = Todd | date = 11 March 2011 | url = http://wot.motortrend.com/chevys-vue-like-captiva-sport-fleets-only-37847.html | title = Chevy’s Vue-Like Captiva Sport is for Fleets Only | work = [[Motor Trend]] | publisher = Source Interlink Media | accessdate = 2010-10-12}}{{-}} == Sales == {| class="wikitable" |- ! {{refimprove|date=December 2013}} {{Infobox automobile | name = Saturn Relay | image = Saturn Relay.jpg | manufacturer = [[General Motors]] | production = June 20, 2004 – November 17, 2006 | model_years = 2005–2007 | assembly = [[Doraville Assembly]], [[Doraville, Georgia]], [[United States]] | class = [[Minivan]] | body_style = 4-door [[minivan]] | platform = [[GM U platform|U-body/GMT201]] | related = [[Buick GL8]]
[[Buick Terraza]]
[[Chevrolet Uplander]]
[[Pontiac Montana|Pontiac Montana SV6]] | layout = [[Front-engine, front-wheel-drive layout|Transverse front-engine, front-wheel drive]] / [[Front-engine, all-wheel-drive layout|all-wheel drive]] | engine = {{ubl |3.5 L ''[[GM High Value engine#LX9|LX9]]'' [[V6]] (gasoline)|3.9 L ''[[GM High Value engine#LZ9|LZ9]]'' [[V6]] (gasoline)|3.9 L ''[[GM High Value engine#LGD|LGD]]'' [[V6]] (gasoline/[[E85]])}} | transmission = {{ubl |4-speed ''[[GM 4T60-E transmission#4T65-E|4T65-E]]'' [[automatic transmission|automatic]]}} | wheelbase = {{convert|121.1|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|204.9|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|72.0|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | height = 2005: {{convert|72.0|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
2006–07: {{convert|68.6|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | weight = {{convert|4426|lb|kg|0|abbr=on}} | predecessor = [[Oldsmobile Silhouette]] | successor = [[Saturn Outlook]] }} The '''Saturn Relay''' is a minivan that was made by General Motors. It was introduced for the 2005 model year, and was built alongside its sisters, the [[Buick Terraza]], the [[Chevrolet Uplander]], and the [[Pontiac Montana SV6]] in [[Doraville, Georgia]]. The Relay was the first Saturn vehicle without [[polymer]] side paneling, the first Saturn that is a [[badge engineering|rebadged]] [[Chevrolet]] or [[Pontiac]], and it was the first (and only) minivan produced by Saturn. [[File:Saturn Relay rear, Polk County, FL (cropped).jpg|thumb|left|Saturn Relay rear]] The Relay was introduced with a 3.5 [[litre|L]] [[GM High Value engine#LX9|LX9]] [[V6]] that generates {{convert|200|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|220|lbft|Nm|abbr=on}} torque, going from 0-60 mph in the 9-second range. For 2006, a 3.9 L [[GM High Value engine#LZ9|LZ9]] V6, with 240 hp (179 kW) and 240 lb·ft (332 Nm) torque, was added as an option, which delivered faster acceleration and better response than the 3.5L engine. For 2007, the 3.5 L V6 was dropped, leaving the 3.9 L as the base engine. Consequently, the optional [[Four-wheel drive|AWD]] system was also dropped, since it could not handle the torque of the 3.9 L engine. Also in 2007, the Relay received an optional [[flexible fuel|flex-fuel]] engine but only for fleet applications.{{cite web|title=2007 Saturn Relay|url=http://archives.media.gm.com/ca/gm/en/products/saturn/archives/2007Relay.html|publisher=[[General Motors]]|accessdate=30 September 2013}} The Relay scored three "Good"s (the highest possible score) and two "acceptable"s (the second highest possible score) in [[Insurance Institute for Highway Safety]] (IIHS) [[crash test]]s. In terms of [[gas mileage]], the Relay is rated at {{convert|19|mpgus }} city, {{convert|25|mpgus }} highway. The Relay started at [[United States dollar|US$]]22,850. There were three available trim levels, ''1'', ''2'', ''3''. The Relay 3 was available in front-wheel drive and in all-wheel drive. All Relays seat seven via folding/removable 2nd row captains chairs and a 50/50 third-row bench. The third-row bench folds flat, but did not fold entirely into the floor. [[OnStar]] assistance and a [[DVD]] rear entertainment system came standard on all Relays. A navigation system was optional on Relay 3s. Side airbags were optional on the Relay. The Relay was discontinued after the 2007 model year and was replaced by the 2007 [[Saturn Outlook]]. ==Changes== ===2006=== 2006 models added the GM logos on the front doors. ===2007=== The final model year of the Relay. The Saturn logos had been dropped from the front doors, and the [[all-wheel drive]] option was no longer available. The Relay was discontinued after the 2007 model year. The [[Doraville Assembly]] plant closed in September 2008. The last 2007 Relay rolled off the line on November 17, 2006. The Relay was replaced by the 8-passenger, Lambda-based [[Saturn Outlook]] [[crossover SUV]]. ==Sales== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Calendar year ! US Sales |- | 2004 | 1,563{{cite web|url=http://www.autointell.com/nao_companies/general_motors/gm-sales/GM-US-data-book-2005.xls|title=GM Deliveries 1996 - 2005}} |- | 2005 | 15,758 |- | 2006 | 7,171 |- | 2007 | 1,474 |- | 2008 | 163 |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commonscat-inline}} *[http://www.saturn.com/saturn/showroom/relay/ Official American site]{{dead link|date=March 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} *[https://web.archive.org/web/20060412152015/http://gmcanada.com/ss/english/vehicles/saturn/relay/relay_overview.jsp Official Canadian site] *[http://www.autoblog.com/2006/08/29/gmc-to-add-minivan-by-2009/ GMC to add minivan, GM to discontinue others.] {{Saturn Corporation}} [[Category:All-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:Front-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:Minivans]] [[Category:Saturn vehicles|Relay]] [[Category:2000s cars]] [[Category:Flexible-fuel vehicles]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 2005]] [[Category:Motor vehicles manufactured in the United States]]
